title: 'More like the England I know' - Canada boss Priestman after Lionesses draw
description: Canada head coach Bev Priestman says England looked "more like the England I know" after her side draw 1-1 with the Lionesses.

title: Australia: The Aboriginal hairdressers delighting remote towns
description: Growing up, Kyle Bambra never had access to a hairdresser - now he's determined to teach others.

title: Tom Daley completes 4-day homecoming challenge for Comic Relief
description: The Olympic gold-medallist rowed, swam, cycled and ran from London to Plymouth for charity.

title: Rylee Foster: Liverpool goalkeeper on 'miracle' recovery after car accident
description: Liverpool goalkeeper Rylee Foster says she has experienced "dark" moments in her recovery from a car accident in October but has been given hope of a return to football.

title: Quiz of the week: Which songs were used as a weapon?
description: How closely have you been paying attention to what's been going on during the past seven days?

title: Ukraine border guards on the watch for Russian advance
description: Fergal Keane travels to northern Ukraine to gauge the mood of those at risk of any Russian advance.

title: Why are French troops leaving Mali, and what will it mean for the region?
description: Will France's decision to remove 5,000 personnel weaken the fight against Islamists in Africa's Sahel?

title: 'This is our home': The Americans who refuse to leave Ukraine
description: The US government has urged its citizens to leave Ukraine, but many have chosen to stay.

title: Nottinghamshire father delivers own child for second time
description: Funeral director Dominic delivered his daughter Alice in a campervan at the side of a road.

title: Child Covid vaccinations: Your questions answered
description: Our health correspondents answer some of your questions.

title: Ukraine: Russia will test our mettle, says Liz Truss
description: The foreign secretary tells the Telegraph the West "must not be lulled into a false sense of security".

title: Storm Eunice: Rare red weather warning issued for parts of the UK
description: The highest alert level means there is danger to life from flying debris, while power cuts are likely.

title: British man, 35, killed in Sydney shark attack
description: Simon Nellist, 35, was killed in a fatal shark attack in Sydney, a friend tells the BBC.

title: Winter Olympics official says human rights abuse stories are 'lies'
description: The Winter Olympics faces renewed political controversy after a Games official dismissed human rights violations among the Uyghur Muslim population as "lies".

title: Louis Thorold: Driver appears in court over A10 crash death
description: Five-month-old Louis Thorold and his mother were hit by a van in Cambridgeshire last January.

title: Saudi Arabia: 28,000 women apply for 30 train driver jobs
description: It is the first time such jobs have been advertised for women in the conservative Muslim kingdom.

title: KitKat and Durex makers Nestle and Reckitt warn of price rises
description: Consumer groups Nestle and Reckitt say product prices will rise to offset higher operating costs.

title: Children in care looked after by grandparents 'on the cheap'
description: James feels it unfair he was paid less for looking after his granddaughter because she is family.

title: Wolves to host England Nations League matches in June
description: England's next two home Nations League matches - against Italy and Hungary - will be played at Wolverhampton Wanderers' Molineux ground in June.

title: Paul Robson: Sex offender who fled HMP North Sea Camp recaptured
description: Paul Robson, 56, spent four days on the run after going missing from an open prison on Sunday.

title: Apple boss Tim Cook faces backlash to £73m pay package
description: A shareholder group says it has "significant concerns" over the size of Tim Cook's pay package.

title: Spurs squad 'weakened' in January - Conte
description: Tottenham boss Antonio Conte believes his squad was "weakened" in the January transfer window despite the club signing two players.

title: Winter Olympics: Great Britain women beat ROC to reach curling semi-finals
description: A 9-4 victory for Great Britain's women over ROC and defeats for Japan and South Korea ensure they qualify for the curling semi-finals at the Winter Olympics in Beijing, where they will face defending champions Sweden.

title: GB women join men in curling semi-finals
description: Great Britain's hopes of earning two curling medals are still alive as the women squeezed into the semi-finals after the men set up a last-four meeting with the United States.

title: Amazon strikes global deal to accept Visa credit cards
description: The online retailer says the agreement will apply worldwide and will remove surcharges on some sites.

title: The divide over Scotland’s gender laws
description: The Scottish government wants to make it easier for trans people's gender to be legally recognised.

title: How farming has changed the lives of young autistic workers
description: Young autistic people say their lives have been changed by working on an Oxfordshire farm.

title: Housing: Fairy tale estate aimed at keeping young people local
description: Brondanw estate is the brainchild of the architect behind the Italianate-style village Portmeirion.

title: The Papers: Cash for honours probe 'deepens crisis for royals'
description: Thursday's front pages focus on the Met Police's investigation into Prince Charles' charity.

title: Schools in England given guidance to avoid biased teaching
description: The education secretary says no subject should be off limits, but that lessons in England must be impartial.

title: 'I lost my dad to prostate cancer, don't lose yours'
description: Danielle Ray's father died aged 63 and more than 14,000 UK men are thought to be undiagnosed.

title: Fight for payment of UK pensions lost in Yemen warzone
description: Yemenis who came to work in British factories in the 1950s have been without payments for years.

title: Can Boris Johnson avoid a lockdown party fine?
description: The PM is hoping his replies to police on Downing Street gatherings will get him off the hook.

title: Ashutosh Kaushik: Indian actor fighting for the 'right to be forgotten'
description: Ashutosh Kaushik says his life is still being held hostage to a youthful folly.

title: The appetite for protein bars gives much to chew on
description: Why are people trying to eat more protein and do protein bars live up to the healthy hype?

title: Swahili's bid to become a language for all of Africa
description: With 200 million speakers there is a renewed push to make Swahili a common language for Africa.

title: French election: Who's vying to challenge Emmanuel Macron?
description: A tight and divisive race is expected when France holds a presidential election in April this year.

title: Covid: What's life like for unvaccinated people in the UK?
description: There are around five million people in the UK who still haven't had a Covid jab.
